body_html:
@paramr There were users who couldn't run official binary because of SSE inclusion -- #6809

So the idea is to have slow "lowest common denominator" official release, and then let users build/distribute versions for the gazillion other configurations out there. I post Xeon V3 specialized wheels here -- https://github.com/yaroslavvb/tensorflow-community-wheels
body_text:
@paramr  There were users who couldn't run official binary because of SSE inclusion -- #6809
So the idea is to have slow "lowest common denominator" official release, and then let users build/distribute versions for the gazillion other configurations out there. I post Xeon V3 specialized wheels here -- https://github.com/yaroslavvb/tensorflow-community-wheels
body:
@paramr  There were users who couldn't run official binary because of SSE inclusion -- https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/6809

So the idea is to have slow "lowest common denominator" official release, and then let users build/distribute versions for the gazillion other configurations out there. I post Xeon V3 specialized wheels here -- https://github.com/yaroslavvb/tensorflow-community-wheels
